revised_title: Interactions of Stimulants on the Function of Isolated Canine Parietal Cells
tldr: This article investigates the interaction of stimulants on the function of isolated canine parietal cells. The study finds that histamine, gastrin, and acetylcholine act directly on the parietal cell, and their potentiating interactions may explain the interdependence between these stimulants in regulating acid secretion.
